data.text: Life in the desert, Life in the forest, and Life in the polar regions
Deserts are barren lands with very little rain and sparse vegetation.
In most deserts, it is very hot during the day but very cold at night.
Hot, dry, dusty winds blow in most deserts.
Deserts that are close to the Tropics are called tropical deserts.
The Sahara Desert, the Arabian Desert, and the Kalahari Desert are some tropical deserts.
Deserts in the middle of a continent are called continental deserts.
The Gobi desert and the Kyzyl Kum desert are continental deserts.
Deserts that lie in the rain shadow areas of mountains are called rain shadow deserts.
The Death Valley Desert and the Atacama Desert are two rain shadow deserts of the world.
Deserts in coastal areas are called coastal deserts.
The Namib Desert in Africa is a coastal desert.
Trees and plants of most deserts are spiny with thick, fleshy stems to store water.
Due to the harsh climate, deserts have a low human population.
Equatorial forests and temperate forests are two major types of forest regions of the world.
Equatorial forests are located close to the equator.
Equatorial forests are also known as tropical rainforests.
Equatorial rainforests are found in South America, Central Africa, and South East Asia.
The Amazon Rainforest in Brazil is the largest rainforest in the world.
Rainforests are home to many species of animals, birds, and insects.
The people living in equatorial forests are usually tribal and have very good hunting skills.
Temperate forests are mostly found between the Tropic of Cancer and the Arctic Circle in the northern hemisphere.
Temperate forests are found in areas where the climate is cold.
Temperate forests are mostly coniferous or alpine.
In coniferous forests, trees are tall with needle-shaped leaves and bear cone-shaped fruits.
Alpine forests are found on the higher slopes of mountains.
The areas around the North and South Pole are called polar regions.
The area within the Antarctic Circle is called the Antarctic region.
The polar regions remain covered with snow throughout the year.
The people who live in the Arctic region are called Inuit.
The Inuit used to build houses, called igloos, out of blocks of snow. Now they live in houses made of insulated material.
Antarctica is a vast ice-covered continent around the South Pole.
There are no permanent human settlements in Antarctica.
The area around the Arctic Circle is called the Arctic region.
